bibl.title: Letter from Raymond O. Dart to Philip Showalter Hench, April 22, 1948

div1.p: Dart informs Hench that a Reed exhibit will be prepared for the International Congress of Tropical Diseases using items from the Army Medical Library and Museum. Hench may then add items of his own when he arrives in Washington. Dart has been unable to find an English translation of Carlos J. Finlay's works.

div1.head: Letter from Raymond O. Dart to Philip Showalter Hench, April 22, 1948
div1.opener:
ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO THE DIRECTOR
AIP 001.2
MEDEM
DEPARTMENT OF PATHOLOGY
AMERICAN REGISTRY OF PATHOLOGY
ARMY INSTITUTE OF PATHOLOGY
7TH STREET AND INDEPENDENCE AVENUE SW
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
22 April 1948
RAS/mdm
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
ARMY MEDICAL ILLUSTRATION SERVICE
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Your extremely heavy schedule, as outlined in your letter of
7 April, clearly will not allow you to arrive in Washington, in time to
place the Walter Reed items on display for the opening of the Fourth
International Congress of Tropical Diseases. Accordingly, we shall use
material from the Army Medical Library and the Army Medical Museum, along
with the Wyeth painting to open the exhibit. On the morning of May 11,
if you so desire, we can remove some of the items from the locked cases
to make room for those valuable materials which you feel are of especial
interest.

Your extensive cooperation in the preparation of the Walter
Reed Memorial Exhibit is greatly appreciated, and it is hoped that these
arrangements will make it possible for you to display some of the more
important items in your valuable collection.

Search is continuing for the English translation of the works
of Dr. Carlos J. Finlay, requested in one of your earlier letters. To date
we have found “Carlos Finlay and Yellow Fever” by his son, Carlos E. Finlay,
M.D., published under the auspices of The Institute of Tropical Medicine
of the University of Havana, by Oxford University Press, New York, in 1940.
This book is in English, however, although it refers to the opinions of
Carlos Finlay, Senior, before the work of the Yellow Fever Commission, it
would not appear to be a translation of Doctor Finlay's original papers.
In all probability, you already have this book in your library.

closer.signed:
RAYMOND O. DART
Colonel, Medical Corps
Director
